author: rkeithhill
body:
<!--

If you are a PowerShell Team member, please make sure you choose the Reviewer(s) and Assignee for your PR.
If you are not from the PowerShell Team, you can leave the fields blank and the Maintainers will choose them for you. If you are familiar with the team, feel free to mention some Reviewers yourself.

For more information about the roles of Reviewer and Assignee, refer to CONTRIBUTING.md.

-->
Using the process picker is much better since if you are using VSCode you are likely to have more than one PowerShell process running.  With the picker, just type `pow` and the process list will filter down to the PowerShell processes.  Just pick the desired process to attach to based on the PID (or command line).

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Great!

Is it possible to add a regex filter like "powershell*"?

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body:
Unfortunately, I don't believe so.  This is a feature of the C#/.NET Core debugger and if you specify `processId`, then you are not supposed to specify `processName`. 

Also, eventually you might want to attach to a host named something other than PowerShell.  :-)  Besides, when you press <kbd>F5</kbd> to attach, the process list will appear, type `pow` and the list will immediately filter down to just the powershell processes.

title: Update launch.json Attach config to use process picker.
